results.title: Why So Many Americans Are So Down on Biden

results.adx_keywords: Burning Man Festival;Rain;Floods;Black Rock Desert (Nev);Nevada
results.byline: By Michael Levenson and Amanda Holpuch
results.title: Burning Man’s ‘Principles’ Encounter a Muddy Fiasco
results.abstract: In the aftermath, a local sheriff complained that festivalgoers were not living up to their core principles of community, responsibility and “leaving no trace.” Now comes the cleanup.

media.caption: Burning Man organizers asked people to avoid driving on Sunday after heavy rains left the site slathered in mud.

results.adx_keywords: Travel and Vacations;Hot Springs;Reykjavik (Iceland)
results.title: 5 Hot Springs in Iceland That Aren’t the Blue Lagoon
results.abstract: Some say Iceland’s more than 600 geothermal springs are the secret to its citizens’ happiness. Here’s a selection of scenic waters in and around Reykjavik where you can test that theory.

media.caption: On the outskirts of Reykjavik, Sky Lagoon, which opened in 2021, is one of Iceland’s most luxurious geothermal pools.

results.title: Ex-Leader of Proud Boys Sentenced to 22 Years in Jan. 6 Sedition Case
results.abstract: The prison term for Enrique Tarrio was the most severe penalty handed down so far to any of the more than 1,100 people charged in connection with the Capitol attack.

media.caption: Enrique Tarrio led the Proud Boys during a period when far-right extremists moved from the fringes toward the center of conservative politics.

results.title: The N.F.L.’s New Kickoff Rule Is a Classically Terrible Idea
results.abstract: I fear the wrath of the football gods.

results.byline: By Camilo Ortiz and Lenore Skenazy
results.title: This Simple Fix Could Help Anxious Kids
results.abstract: Overprotection may be making kids scared of the world. If so, wouldn’t the obvious solution be more independence?

results.adx_keywords: Skin Cancer;Pop and Rock Music;Buffett, Jimmy
results.title: Jimmy Buffett Died of Rare Form of Skin Cancer
results.abstract: The singer’s website said he had Merkel cell carcinoma for four years and died at his home on Long Island.

media.caption: Jimmy Buffett died of a rare and aggressive form of skin cancer, Merkel cell carcinoma.

results.title: New York City’s Crackdown on Airbnb Is Starting. Here’s What to Expect.
results.abstract: On Tuesday, the city will start enforcing strict new rules on how and when New Yorkers can rent out homes using platforms like Airbnb and Vrbo.

media.caption: New York City officials have estimated that as many as 10,000 short-term rentals listed on Airbnb at the end of last year were illegal.

results.title: Coach of Spain’s Women’s Soccer Team Is Fired
results.abstract: Players had accused the coach, Jorge Vilda, of outdated methods and controlling behavior. His boss, Luis Rubiales, is still embroiled in scandal over a nonconsensual kiss.

media.caption: Jorge Vilda, the head coach of the Spanish women’s soccer team, after the team’s victory in the World Cup final in Australia last month.

results.title: After Mass Killing of Trees on a Wealthy Waterfront, a Theory Takes Hold
results.abstract: The brazen culling of more than 250 trees at a waterside reserve in Australia, the speculation goes, had the goal of producing a better view.

media.caption: Damaged trees in Castle Cove, Australia, on Wednesday.

results.adx_keywords: Pop and Rock Music;Deaths (Obituaries);Harwell, Steve;Smash Mouth (Music Group)
results.byline: By Claire Moses and Ben Sisario
results.title: Steve Harwell, Voice of the Band Smash Mouth, Is Dead at 56
results.abstract: He was a founding member of the band, which broke out in the late 1990s with hit songs like “Walkin’ on the Sun” and “All Star.”

media.caption: Mr. Harwell performing in 2003. “We didn’t want to be labeled as a punk band, a ska band, a surf band, a rock band, a pop band or a whatever band,” he said. “We just wanted to be us.”

results.title: Burning Man Attendees Begin to Leave Soggy Festival Site
results.abstract: After days of torrential rain, an exodus from the Nevada desert site began on Monday. The festival’s fiery climax, postponed twice, finally took place.

results.title: A Final Goodbye to Opiates
results.abstract: A filmmaker captures her attempt to come off the synthetic opiates that kept her off heroin for the past six years.

results.title: Undying Dread: A 400-Year-Old Corpse, Locked to Its Grave
results.abstract: In 17th-century Europe, the dead were a constant threat to rise again and bedevil the living. Now archaeologists have found the remains of a suspected child revenant.

results.byline: By Edward Wong and Julian E. Barnes
results.title: Kim Jong-un and Putin Plan to Meet in Russia to Discuss Weapons
results.abstract: Russia seeks more weaponry for its war in Ukraine, and a North Korean delegation recently traveled to Russia by train to plan for Mr. Kim’s visit this month, officials say.

media.caption: A photograph released by North Korean state news shows Kim Jong-un, right, with Sergei K. Shoigu, the Russian defense minister, in July. Mr. Kim is expected to travel to meet President Vladimir V. Putin in Russia.

results.title: Where the Universe Began
results.abstract: A half-century ago, a radio telescope in Holmdel, N.J., sent two astronomers 13.8 billion years back in time — and opened a cosmic window that scientists have been peering through ever since.
